description.narrative: Project focuses on the establishment of a regional governance mechanism to facilitate conservation and sustainable development of the coastal and marine resources of the ATS. The initiative suppors responsible fishing practices.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
- Number of management plans and appropriate measures implemented for rebuilding or protecting fish stocks including alternative management approaches
- Number of targeted communities of fishers have adopted an ecosystem approach to fisheries management
- Reduced fishing pressure
- Improved use of fish gear/techniques

comment.narrative:
• 0 Number of management plans & targeted communities
• Aru, Indonesia: Approx. 775 registered fishing vessels in Aru operating in the red snapper and shrimp fisheries (combined).
• Aru, Indonesia: Approx. 775 registered fishing vessels in Aru operating in the shrimp and red snapper fisheries; 775 vessels (<30 GT) which do not have VMS; 1400 vessels using gillnet gear.

Outcome 1 Regional , national and local governance for large marine ecosystem management is in place Outcome 2 Improved LME in carrying capacity to sustain provisioning, regulating ans supporting ecosystem services Outcome 3 Improved knowledge of target beneficiaries

- Improved fish practices and ecosystem-based approach for fisheries is introduced - Data base system is established - Integrated coastal management plans is prepared - improved monitoring mechanism and knowledge dissemination

1. Establishment of the NIMC Indonesia 2. Technical support for the operationalization of the Fisheries Management Body (LPP) of the Fisheries Management Area (WPP) 718. 3. Establishment of the Provincial Marine Pollution Task Force in NTT province. 4. Initiation of the collaboration with Musamus University in Merauke district, Papua province to establish Papua regions EAFM Learning center. 5. Development of the Kolepom MPA Zonation plan. 6. Development of the Early warning system tool for oil spill in Timor seas. 7. Improved facilities of the science lab for better managing fisheries stock data.

1. The draft of National Inter Ministerial Committees (NIMCs) concept has been developed as the output of series of consultation in 2021. The legal assessment to support the formalization process of the NIMCs has been established, which comprises the legal structure options, operational plan, and roles and responsibilities of the members. The NIMCs model design will be aligned with the SPF structure which is under development. Additionally, the NIMCs institutional mapping and programs from each ministry that could contribute to the implementation of the ATSEA-2 NAP has been made available. 2. ATSEA-2 supported the process of updating the Operational guidelines of the WPPNRI LPP 718 in collaboration with local stakeholders who worked in WPP 718. The NCU is part of the partnership working group led by the Maluku Provincial Authority in collaboration with other CSOs. 3. The Marine Pollution Task Force in NTT Province has been established and formalized through a governor decree of NTT No.260/2021. The team has already established the action plan to strengthening the marine pollution handling through some strategies, such as strengthening the database, developing a monitoring and reporting mechanism, capacity building, and developing a well-established network with community and other stakeholder. 4. The establishment of EAFM learning Center is still currently underway. Some initial process which has been completed include capacity building of the lecturer, local government, and other local stakeholder through EAFM training that have been supported by LC EAFM from Pattimura University. Technical skills related to utilization of the EAFM tools have been improved by 47,5% in average from 11 participant. Additionally, knowledge sharing mechanism has been established to support LC EAFM in Papua. 5. Draft zonation plan of Kolepom Island has been developed. Three scenarios have been discussed internally by the zonation working group that have been formalized through SK Sekda Papua No.188.4/21536/SET in 2021. The conservation target has been decided to conserve estuarine area, demersal fisheries, and sawfish. The public consultation will be held in 2022 6. The development of early warning system is currently underway. It is now in the stage of recruitment process (the bidder’s selection). The main objective of the recruitment is to develop an integrated monitoring and reporting system to support quick respond on situation related to marine pollution, to develop an oil spill contingency plan and to provide conceptual model of revolving fund mechanism to manage the oil spill in Timor Seas, East Nusa Tenggara Provincial. 7. The plan to establish an improved facilities of the science lab for better managing fisheries stock data has been cancelled. This is due to the restructuring process of government agencies, which has affected the authorities and responsibilities related to the respective agencies. The transition of Pusriskan to BRIN has changed the authority and resources availability related to the fisheries database management, namely from MMAF to BRIN.

• Improved stakeholder participation at the regional and national (establishment of a Stakeholder Partnership Forum) • Improved inter sectoral coordination at the national and local levels • Harmonization of national and local policy in Indonesia • Ecosystem approach to fisheries management (EAFM) assessment • Development of profiles of 3 fisheries in the ATSEA, value chain analysis and pre-assessment • Support strengthening of regional and national actions for Responsible Fishing Practices Including Combating IUU Fishing • Strengthening the capacity of stakeholder in NTT to respone marine pollution • Updated information and database on coral, mangrove and seagrass beds in the ATS • Establish new MPA in Kolepom and Improve management effectiveness in SAP southeast Aru • Implementation of Integrated Coastal Management

In 2020, the project established the management body for FMA 718, engaged bio-economy assessment for shrimp as basis information of sea management at FMA 718, updated Fisheries Management plan for FMA 718 to harmonized national and local policy. The EAFM strategy and action for management guidance was developed and EAFM assessment for red snapper in Aru district are now available with the aggregate status from 6 domains is yellow to green. The project concluded the EAFM assessment for shrimp fisheries in Aru district with recommendation on aggregate status from 6 domains is red to green. Fisheries profile for Red snapper, which provides the information on fisheries characteristic, status of population, value chain and MSC’s pre-Assessment. Moreover, Initial report of shrimp fisheries profile in FMA 718 were developed, which provide the information on stock status and production. On capacity building, the support to the initiation of forum for prosecution of fisheries violations in Papua province was given. Capacity building are designed and planned to support pilot study of data science and management for fisheries surveillance in FMA 718. Project also facilitated the the initiation of marine pollution task force for NTT, as well as support the development of action plan document for this task force, and updated status on the health of marine resources based on remote sensing and field work (biophysical survey).
New MPA initiation in Kolepom island were developed that cover 350,000 Ha ( Governor Decree Papua No.188.4/295/2019) 350,000 Ha. In 2020, project contributed in increasing status of management effectiveness of existing MPA in SAP Southeast Aru, from 58% to 68% since the intervention from ATSEA-2. Report progress on climate change assessment and marine pollution in the regional include in Rote Ndao district were developed.
All activities in 2020, were contributed to the strengthened marine management for target fisheries.

1. Developed the legalization of NIMCs and SPF 2. Developed Fisheries database platform in Maluku Province to support Sustainable fisheries 3. Established the IUU fisheries Forum in Maluku district to support surveillance in Fisheries Management Plan 718 4. Developed a tool for Early warning System of marine pollution mechanism which is led by NTT provincial government 5. Established of MPA Kolepom in Merauke District through Ministerial decree of MMAF 6. Established Gender mainstreaming Working Group (PUG) in Rote Ndao and Aru district to support implemention of the Gender action plan.
